article.Heading: Budget presentation on track, but LS speaker to decide on format
article.Summary: Ahamed had served as minister of state for external affairs in the erstwhile UPA government.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

The Union Budget 2017-18 will be presented today. However, a change in format, if any, will be decided by Lok Sabha Speaker Sumitra Mahajan. 

Following the passing away of Former Central Minister and sitting Lok Sabha MP E Ahamed's early on Wednesday, uncertainty loomed over the Budget presentation.

According to tradition, in the event of the death of a sitting MP, the House adjourns for a day, after mourning the member's death.

Mahajan will consult the Lok Sabha Secretary General, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Ananth Kumar, opposition leader Mallikarjun Kharge and the Attorney General before deciding on the change in format.

There are three possible likelihoods. One, the Budget will presented in the Rajya Sabha alone; it could be presented post lunch session and third, the Budget will be presented in Lok Sabha after which both houses of the Parliament will be adjourned for the day.

Ahamed had served as minister of state for external affairs in the erstwhile UPA government.

He had suffered a heart attack during President Pranab Mukherjee's address to the joint session of Parliament on Tuesday.
